snippet: Lost in the anger about Derrick Rose’s refusal to play is that many people blamed Rose’s A.C.L. tear last year on a premature return from other injuries. With that, caution makes sense.
abstract: Scott Turow essay examines anger of Chicago Bulls fans over point guard Derrick Rose's refusal to play following long rehabilitation from torn anterior cruciate ligament; holds that lost in the anger is fact that ACL tear was likely caused by premature return to court in 2012 after other injuries, and that cautious decision makes long-term sense for both Rose and team.
lead_paragraph: Lost in the anger about Derrick Rose’s refusal to play is that many people blamed Rose’s A.C.L. tear last year on a premature return from other injuries. With that, caution makes sense.

headline.seo: Derrick Rose’s Decision to Sit Out Was Prudent, if Not Popular
headline.main: A Prudent Move by Rose, if Not a Popular One
